required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Serum Biomarkers Associated With Postpartum T2DM in Women With GDM
clinical_study.official_title: Pregnancy to Postpartum Transition of Serum Biomarkers in Women With Gestational Diabetes

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

brief_summary.textblock: Gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) is commonly linked to the development of type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM). There is a need to characterize metabolic changes associated with GDM in order to find novel biomarkers for T2DM.

detailed_description.textblock: GDM, a common complication of pregnancy, affects 17.8% of pregnancies worldwide per year. Women with a history of GDM have an approximately 7-fold higher risk for developing T2DM in the future than women without GDM. However, data on the factors associated with the development of T2DM in women with GDM are not widely available.

primary_outcome.description: Women with GDM develop T2DM in postpartum.

secondary_outcome.description: Women with GDM were impaired glucose intolerance in postpartum.

arm_group.description: Women who were diagnosed GDM in 24-28 gestation weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women who were dignosed GDM.
- Women with singleton pregnancy.
- Give birth in the First Affiliated Hospital in Sun Yat-sen University.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women who were diagnosed PGDM.
- Younger than 18 years old.
- Older than 45 years old.
- Multiple pregnancy.
- Diagnosed DM before.
- Complicationg other diseases, like hypertension, thyroid diseases, etc.
- Taking any drug affect glucose and lipid metabolism.

overall_official.affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

facility.name: Obstetrics and Gynechology Department of the 1st affiliated hospital of Sun Yat-sen University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University
